questions.question: When does registration open?
questions.answer: Registration for ICPC Sri Lanka 2026 opens in November 2025. Make sure to register early as spots are limited!

questions.question: How much is the registration fee?
questions.answer: There is no registration fee for the Preliminary Online Round. For the Regional Onsite Round, the registration fee is LKR 2,000 per team. This fee includes meals and logistics on the day of the contest.

questions.question: Can we register multiple teams from the same university?
questions.answer: Yes! Multiple teams from the same university can register, subject to contest capacity. Each team must have 3 different students and a coach.

questions.question: What if we don't have a coach?
questions.answer: A coach is required for registration. You must find a faculty member or staff from your university to act as your team coach.

questions.question: How many members should be in a team?
questions.answer: Each team must have exactly 3 members plus 1 coach. All members must be from the same university.

questions.question: Can graduate students participate?
questions.answer: Yes! Both undergraduate and graduate students are eligible, as long as they meet ICPC eligibility requirements.

questions.question: Can team members be from different departments?
questions.answer: Yes! Team members can be from different departments or faculties, as long as they are all enrolled at the same university.

questions.question: What programming languages are allowed?
questions.answer: C, C++, Java, Python, and other ICPC-approved programming languages. The exact list will be provided closer to the contest date.

questions.question: How long is the contest?
questions.answer: The regional contest lasts 5 hours. Teams work together to solve 8-12 programming problems.

questions.question: Can we bring reference materials?
questions.answer: Yes! Teams can bring printed reference materials (books, notes, etc.). However, no electronic devices except the provided computer are allowed.

questions.question: Where will the contest be held?
questions.answer: The contest location will be announced closer to the event date. It will be held in a major city in Sri Lanka with proper facilities.

questions.question: How should we prepare for ICPC?
questions.answer: Practice solving algorithmic problems on platforms like Codeforces, LeetCode, and HackerRank. Study data structures, algorithms, and problem-solving techniques. Practice as a team!

questions.question: Are there practice contests before the regional?
questions.answer: Yes! There will be an online preliminary round in October-November 2025 to help teams prepare and qualify for the regional contest.

questions.question: What topics should we focus on?
questions.answer: Focus on data structures (graphs, trees, heaps), algorithms (sorting, searching, dynamic programming), mathematics, and string processing.

questions.question: What happens after we register?
questions.answer: You'll receive a confirmation email with further instructions about payment, contest details, and important dates.

questions.question: Can we change team members after registration?
questions.answer: Changes may be possible before a certain deadline. Contact the organizing committee as soon as possible if you need to make changes.

questions.question: How will we know if we qualify for the World Finals?
questions.answer: The champion team from the Sri Lanka National Contest advances directly to the ICPC World Finals. Five runner-up teams will compete at the Asia West Regional, where top performers also advance to the World Finals.

questions.question: What prizes will the winners receive?
questions.answer: Winners will receive trophies, official ICPC certificates, cash prizes, and exciting awards. All teams will receive certificates of participation.

questions.question: What does 'one award per institution' mean?
questions.answer: Only one award per institution means that a maximum of six teams from six different universities will receive awards. This ensures fair distribution of recognition across universities and encourages participation from diverse institutions throughout Sri Lanka.

questions.question: Will travel and accommodation be covered?
questions.answer: Yes! Teams advancing to the Asia West Regional and World Finals will have their accommodations covered, including lodging and meals for team members.

questions.question: Are there cash prizes?
questions.answer: Yes, there will be cash prizes for winning teams along with trophies and certificates. Additional exciting awards will also be announced closer to the contest date.
